titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Who's Teaching Us?, records SC1296
titlestmt.author: Jenny Johnson and Josh Schneider

publicationstmt.publisher: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2018-05-10 08:52:00 -0700.

repository.corpname: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

did.physloc: Special Collections and University Archives materials are stored offsite and must be paged 48 hours in advance. For more information on paging collections, see the department's website: http://library.stanford.edu/spc.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes white paper and list of demands.

bioghist.head: Organizational History
bioghist.p: Whoâ€™s Teaching Us (WTU) was started by the Stanford Asian American Activism Committee (SAAAC) in 2014 when the Stanford English Department denied tenure to Professor Stephen Hong Sohn, a queer Asian American scholar with a vital mentorship role in the community. Members of SAAAC recognized that what happened to Professor Sohn was commonplace for professors from underrepresented backgrounds, and formed this cross-community coalition to address this injustice.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: All requests to reproduce, publish, quote from, or otherwise use collection materials must be submitted in writing to the Head of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, California 94305-6064. Consent is given on behalf of Special Collections as the owner of the physical items and is not intended to include or imply permission from the copyright owner. Such permission must be obtained from the copyright owner, heir(s) or assigns. See: http://library.stanford.edu/spc/using-collections/permission-publish. Restrictions also apply to digital representations of the original materials. Use of digital files is restricted to research and educational purposes.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Who's Teaching Us Records (SC1296). Dept. of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The materials are open for research use; materials must be requested at least 48 hours in advance of intended use. Audio-visual materials are not available in original format, and must be reformatted to a digital use copy.

did.unittitle: White paper and list of demands (2 files)
